item.title: Booking
item.description:
Booking an Appointment

Scheduling a consultation with Andromeda Law is simple and convenient. Our online booking system allows you to choose a time that fits your schedule, ensuring a seamless and stress-free experience.

How to Book

  1. Choose Your Service: Select the type of legal consultation you need from our services page. This helps us prepare for your specific requirements.

  2. Pick a Date and Time: Use our online booking tool to view available time slots and choose one that works for you. We offer extended hours to accommodate various schedules.

item.title: Cancellation Policy
item.description:
Cancellation Policy

At Andromeda Law, we understand that schedules can change unexpectedly. Our cancellation and rescheduling policies are designed to be fair and considerate for both our clients and our practice.

Please note: This cancellation policy applies to non-retainer clients scheduling prepaid consultations. Clients who have an ongoing retainer agreement with us are not subject to cancellation fees; however, cancellations or rescheduling may result in additional billable time due to preparation and administrative efforts.

item.title: Rates
item.description:
Clear and Transparent Pricing

At Andromeda Law, we believe in making legal costs straightforward and transparent. We offer competitive hourly rates and flat fees for specific services to help you understand the expenses involved from the outset. Please note that all fees are subject to Harmonized Sales Tax (HST) as required by Ontario law.

Hourly Rate

Our general hourly rate is $300 per hour. This rate applies to:

  • General Litigation: Representation in civil litigation matters, including complex cases in the Superior Court of Justice and the Ontario Court of Appeal.
  • General Legal Advice: Consultations and advice on various legal matters not covered by our flat-fee services.
  • Reviewing/Updating Existing Employment Contracts: For employers looking to review or update their current employment contracts.

Free 15-Minute Consultation

For litigation matters billed at our general hourly rate (such as Superior Court cases, defending Small Claims, or more complex Small Claims cases), we offer a free 15-minute initial consultation. This allows us to assess your situation and determine how we can assist you.
